sub_fields.label: Source Type
sub_fields.name: type
sub_fields.instructions: Choose how file should be imported

sub_fields.label: File
sub_fields.name: file
sub_fields.instructions: Must be tsv, csv

sub_fields.label: Url
sub_fields.name: url
sub_fields.instructions: Url must link directly to data file in either .csv,.json, or .tsv format

sub_fields.label: Text
sub_fields.name: text
sub_fields.instructions: input json code

sub_fields.label: Rows
sub_fields.name: row
sub_fields.instructions: Input a basic data in rows

sub_fields.label: Label (Data 1)
sub_fields.instructions: data that will represent the labels or a separate axis of the data.

sub_fields.label: Value (Data 2)
sub_fields.instructions: data that will represent the labels.

sub_fields.label: Source Key
sub_fields.name: key
sub_fields.instructions: Fill in the key for the data to use if it is not in the root level

fields.label: Data Keys
fields.name: dv_data_key
fields.instructions: Fill in the key for the data to use if it is not in the root level

sub_fields.label: Name Key
sub_fields.instructions:
Type in the key relative to the data instance
Key or column name to represent or name the data

sub_fields.label: Value Key
sub_fields.instructions:
Type in the key relative to the data instance
Key or column name of the data that will represent data based on the name key

fields.label: Set Name Key As Numeric
fields.name: dv_name_is_num
fields.message: Convert name key to an axis of numeric data

sub_fields.label: Axis Data
sub_fields.name: data
sub_fields.instructions: Data key to represent horizontally

sub_fields.label: Alignment
sub_fields.name: align
sub_fields.instructions: Where to align the axis

sub_fields.label: Use Ticks?
sub_fields.name: ticks
sub_fields.message: Checking will display axis this on a rule instead of inside the graph element

sub_fields.label: Label
sub_fields.name: label
sub_fields.instructions: Label for horizontal data. will default to y axis key

sub_fields.label: Prepend
sub_fields.name: prepend
sub_fields.instructions: Character to prepend tick label

sub_fields.label: Append
sub_fields.name: append
sub_fields.instructions: Character to append tick label

sub_fields.label: Divider
sub_fields.name: divider
sub_fields.instructions: Divide numeric data to shorten tick label

sub_fields.label: Minimum
sub_fields.name: min
sub_fields.instructions:
value of the minimum tick mark.
Leave blank if desired first tick mark value is the minimum value in the data
to disable tick marks to scale with data updates, setting a value is recommended.

sub_fields.label: Maximum
sub_fields.name: max
sub_fields.instructions:
value of the maximum tick mark.
Leave blank if desired first tick mark value is the maximum value in the data
to disable tick marks to scale with data updates, setting a value is recommended.

sub_fields.label: Ticks Amount
sub_fields.name: ticks_amount
sub_fields.instructions: number of tick marks along the axis

sub_fields.label: Add Grid (testing)
sub_fields.name: grid
sub_fields.message: add lines that will represent a grid along the axis

sub_fields.label: Grid Increment
sub_fields.name: grid_increment
sub_fields.instructions: How many ticks the grid will align to. leaving this blank will equal to 1

sub_fields.label: Ticks Parameter
sub_fields.name: ticks_parameter
sub_fields.instructions:
accepts string format or function
Reference: https://github.com/d3/d3-format
Setting this will override Tick Format settings

sub_fields.label: Axis Data
sub_fields.name: data
sub_fields.instructions: Data key to represent horizontally

sub_fields.label: Alignment
sub_fields.name: align
sub_fields.instructions: Where to align the axis

sub_fields.label: Use Ticks?
sub_fields.name: ticks
sub_fields.message: Checking will display axis this on a rule instead of inside the graph element

sub_fields.label: Label
sub_fields.name: label
sub_fields.instructions: Label for horizontal data. will default to y axis key

sub_fields.label: Prepend
sub_fields.name: prepend
sub_fields.instructions: Character to prepend tick label

sub_fields.label: Append
sub_fields.name: append
sub_fields.instructions: Character to append tick label

sub_fields.label: Divider
sub_fields.name: divider
sub_fields.instructions: Divide numeric data to shorten tick label

sub_fields.label: Minimum
sub_fields.name: min
sub_fields.instructions:
value of the minimum tick mark.
Set as blank if desired first tick mark value is the minimum value in the data
to disable tick marks to scale with data updates, setting a value is recommended.

sub_fields.label: Maximum
sub_fields.name: max
sub_fields.instructions:
value of the maximum tick mark.
Leave blank if desired first tick mark value is the maximum value in the data
to disable tick marks to scale with data updates, setting a value is recommended.

sub_fields.label: Ticks Amount
sub_fields.name: ticks_amount
sub_fields.instructions: number of tick marks along the axis

sub_fields.label: Add Grid (testing)
sub_fields.name: grid
sub_fields.message: add lines that will represent a grid along the axis

sub_fields.label: Grid Increment
sub_fields.name: grid_increment
sub_fields.instructions: How many ticks the grid will align to. leaving this blank will equal to 1

sub_fields.label: Ticks Parameter
sub_fields.name: ticks_parameter
sub_fields.instructions:
accepts string format or function
Reference: https://github.com/d3/d3-format
Setting this will override Tick Format settings

sub_fields.label: Add Plot Points?
sub_fields.name: points
sub_fields.message: Add points to align to data coordinates

sub_fields.label: Add Area Fill?
sub_fields.name: fill
sub_fields.message: Set a fill color to the side nearest to the name axis

sub_fields.label: Points Color
sub_fields.name: points_color
sub_fields.instructions: Leaving this blank will set this as set graph line color if that is set

sub_fields.label: Fill against the axis?
sub_fields.name: fill_invert
sub_fields.message: Add fill to the side opposite of the name key axis's alignment

sub_fields.label: Dash Array
sub_fields.name: dash
sub_fields.instructions:
Set dashes on the line graph. The pattern is `dash, gap, dash, gap...`
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

sub_fields.label: Data Format
sub_fields.name: data_format
sub_fields.instructions:
accepts string format or function
Reference: https://github.com/d3/d3-format
Setting this will override Pie Label settings

sub_fields.label: Colors Data Key
sub_fields.name: data_key
sub_fields.instructions: Data key to link color scheme to. if layout is set to line, this will be applied to plot points and will override set points color

fields.label: Optimize for performance
fields.name: dv_optimize
fields.instructions: Optimize rendering for performance (note: turning this one may cause script conflicts)
